Description: Fragment of rim and bowl of possibly Milesian plate or shallow dish; medium-coarse clay with white inclusions; underside reserved and unsmoothed; stopt maeander frieze between bands on top of lip; various bands, one at least with added red, at edge of bowl; back of neck of lion, with red neck, to right, in tondo. Two pre-firing suspension holes on rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.291)
